tier_1_determinative.five_or_more_persons_committing_dacoity: It is alleged that 7 accused stopped a truck driven by the complainant and fled away with a sum of Rs.85,000/-, thereby committing robbery.

tier_2_material.property_stolen: A sum of Rs.85,000/- was stolen during the robbery.

tier_3_contextual.incident_location: The incident occurred in connection with C.R. No.I-139 of 2018 registered with Mumbra Police Station.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Arshad Riyaz Shaikh alias Madrasi vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_appellant: Adv. Prashant Pandey a/w Adv. Dinesh Jadhwani i/b. W3Legal LLP
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_respondent: Mr. S. V. Gavand, APP for the State
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Sections 395, 397, 323, 341, 506 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860; Sections 3 read with Section 25 of the Arms Act, 1959; Sections 37 read with Section 135 of the Maharashtra Police Act, 1951.
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code, 1860; Arms Act, 1959; Maharashtra Police Act, 1951.

residual_details.additional_facts: The applicant has been in custody for more than 4 years and 10 months. The trial has been expedited but the charge is yet to be framed. The co-accused Nos.1 and 2 have been granted bail by the Sessions Court. The applicant is alleged to have been walking in front and around the victimâ€™s truck with a knife to keep a check. Despite criminal antecedents reported against the applicant, he was granted bail on the ground of parity.
